Common causes of engine overheating include: low engine coolant, a cracked radiator, broken fans or a broken water pump. Ignoring a rising engine temperature gauge is the worst thing that you can do.Â This can lead to tons of costly repairs including fixing a blown head gasket. Differential Fluid – (A rear differential is only found on rear wheel drive cars and trucks.) Inspect: The rear differential (commonly referred to as the rear end) fluid or grease should be checked during each routine oil change and topped off as needed with the fluid prescribed in the owner’s manual.
